meanings.definition: To remove a peg or pegs from.
meanings.sent1: She was unpegging the clothes from the line.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was unpegging the wooden pieces for the new project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was unpegging the acorns from the tree, causing a mess below.
meanings.sent4: The magician unpegged the hidden card from the deck with a swift move.
meanings.sent5: The gardener unpegged the wilted flowers to make space for new ones.

meanings.definition: To detach or disengage from a fixed position or value.
meanings.sent1: The astronaut was unpegging himself from the spaceship before the spacewalk.
meanings.sent2: The currency exchange rate was unpegging from the US dollar.
meanings.sent3: The cat was unpegging itself from the top of the curtain, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was unpegging from the worries, allowing her to focus on the present moment.
meanings.sent5: The old painting was unpegging itself from the wall, revealing a hidden message underneath.
